   138â†’    },
   139â†’    {
   140â†’      id: 'mistake-4-shortcuts',
   141â†’      title: 'Mistake #4: Looking for Shortcuts',
   142â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
   143â†’      content: `There are no shortcuts. There are no hacks. There is no "one weird trick."
   144â†’
   145â†’The internet is full of people trying to sell you things you don't need:
   146â†’- Miracle supplements that do nothing
   147â†’- Expensive gadgets that collect dust
   148â†’- "Secret" techniques that are just repackaged basics
   149â†’
   150â†’**Here's what actually works:**

   159â†’    },
   160â†’    {
   161â†’      id: 'mistake-5-all-or-nothing',
   162â†’      title: 'Mistake #5: All-or-Nothing Thinking',
   163â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   164â†’      content: `You miss one gym session and think "welp, the whole week is ruined."
   165â†’You eat one bad meal and say "might as well order pizza for the rest of the week."
   166â†’You skip your skincare once and abandon the routine entirely.
   167â†’
   168â†’**This is self-sabotage with extra steps.**
   169â†’
   170â†’Progress isn't linear. Life happens. The goal isn't perfectionâ€”it's **consistency over time**.
   171â†’
   172â†’Missing one day means nothing. Missing one day, then letting it spiral into one week, then one month? That's the killer.
   173â†’
   174â†’**The rule:** If you miss, just get back on track the next opportunity. No guilt, no drama. Just reset and continue.`,
   175â†’      tips: [
   176â†’        'One bad day is noise. One bad month is a pattern.',

   182â†’      id: 'mistake-6-money-before-basics',
   183â†’      title: 'Mistake #6: Spending Money Before Basics',
   184â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
   185â†’      content: `You're researching jaw implants but you're at 22% body fat.
   186â†’You want Botox but you've never worn sunscreen.
   187â†’You're considering hair transplants but you sleep 5 hours a night.
   188â†’
   189â†’**You're skipping chapters, my guy.**
   190â†’
   191â†’Here's the priority order:
   192â†’1. **Free tier:** Sleep, hydration, basic hygiene, mewing, posture
   193â†’2. **Low cost ($20-50/mo):** Gym, skincare basics, grooming tools
   194â†’3. **Medium cost ($50-200/mo):** Supplements, better products, minoxidil
   195â†’4. **High cost ($500+):** Treatments, procedures, surgery
   196â†’
   197â†’Don't level skip. The expensive stuff doesn't work if the foundation is garbage.
   198â†’

   200â†’      warnings: [
   201â†’        "Surgery doesn't fix lifestyle problems",
   202â†’        'Get to 12% body fat before considering facial procedures'
   203â†’      ],
   204â†’    },
   205â†’    {
   206â†’      id: 'the-real-strategy',
   207â†’      title: 'The Actual Strategy That Works',
   208â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   209â†’      content: `Here's what the successful guys do:
   210â†’
   211â†’**1. Accept the timeline**
   212â†’You're playing a 1-2 year game minimum. Accept that now or quit.
   213â†’
   214â†’**2. Build systems, not goals**
   215â†’"I want a better jawline" is a goal. "I chew mastic gum for 20 minutes after every meal" is a system. Systems win.
   216â†’
   217â†’**3. Track ruthlessly**
   218â†’Take monthly photos. Same lighting, same angle, same expression. This is the only objective measure.
   219â†’
   220â†’**4. Iterate slowly**
   221â†’Add one new thing every 4-6 weeks. Not five things at once. You need to know what's actually working.
   222â†’
   223â†’**5. Focus on the 80/20**
   224â†’20% of actions produce 80% of results. For most guys:
   225â†’- Getting lean (diet + exercise)
   226â†’- Skincare (cleanser, moisturizer, sunscreen)
   227â†’- Grooming (hair, brows, facial hair)
   228â†’
   229â†’**Nail these before anything else.**`,
   230â†’      tips: [
   231â†’        'Progress compounds over time',
   232â†’        'Small daily actions beat occasional big efforts',
   233â†’        'Document everything so you can see the change'

   235â†’      media: [

  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'Why Your Internal Clock Matters',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Your circadian rhythm controls everythingâ€”sleep quality, testosterone output, cortisol, appetite, mood, energy, and even how tight your physique looks day-to-day.

When this rhythm is aligned, your body works with you. When it's not, you're fighting your own biology.

**What Circadian Alignment Gets You:**
- Better sleep quality without trying
- Higher testosterone output
- Lower baseline cortisol
- More consistent energy and recovery
- Sharper facial features (less puffiness)

**What Misalignment Costs You:**
- Garbage sleep even with 8+ hours
- Hormonal dysfunction
- Chronic inflammation
- Water retention and puffiness
- Brain fog and low motivation

This is the closest thing to a "natural testosterone booster" that actually worksâ€”because circadian alignment is what your endocrine system evolved around.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'circadian-alignment',
      title: 'What Circadian Alignment Actually Means',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Circadian alignment** means your body knows exactly what to do at every hour because your internal clock matches external light cues.

When it's aligned:
- You wake up naturally
- Energy peaks in the morning
- You get tired at the right time
- Sleep is deep and restorative

**The Rhythm Is Built on Light:**
- Morning light = "wake up, produce cortisol, be alert"
- Evening darkness = "wind down, produce melatonin, prepare for sleep"

If you flood your retina with blue/white light at night, melatonin drops and your entire system refuses to switch into sleep mode.

**The Goal:** Make your environment look like sunset after sunset.

**Core Rules:**
- Disable bright overhead lights after sunset
- Switch screens to warm-tone mode
- Avoid LED white light in the last hour before bed
- Use lamps, not ceiling lights

You're basically signaling to your brain: "we're done for the day."`,

  title: 'Anti-Aging Guide for Women',

  description: "Evidence-based anti-aging from your 20s to 60s. Skincare, lifestyle, and procedures that actually work.",

  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Anti-Aging Reality',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Let's be honest: aging is inevitable. But how you age is largely within your control.

**The Hard Truths:**
- 80% of visible aging comes from sun exposure
- You can't out-product a bad lifestyle
- Prevention is 10x more effective than reversal
- The best anti-aging routine is boring and consistent

**The Good News:**
- Starting in your 20s-30s can prevent most wrinkles
- Modern skincare actually works (if you pick the right ingredients)
- Procedures have gotten safer, more natural, and more accessible
- It's never too late to improve

**This Guide Covers:**
1. The science of skin aging
2. Skincare by decade

5. When to consider procedures`,

      id: 'science',

- Fat pads shift and diminish
- Bones lose volume (yes, this affects your face)

**Extrinsic Aging (External):**

- **Pollution:** Free radical damage, inflammation
- **Smoking:** Decreases blood flow, accelerates wrinkles
- **Sugar:** Glycation damages collagen fibers

/**
 * Core & Neck Training Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const coreNeckGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'core-neck',
  slug: 'core-neck-training',
  title: 'Core & Neck Training',
  subtitle: "The overlooked muscles that change everything",
  description: "Build a solid core for posture and a thick neck for masculine presence. Both are underrated game-changers.",
  icon: 'Target',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 8,
  order: 6,
  tags: ['core', 'neck', 'posture', 'training', 'aesthetics'],
  relatedGuides: ['training', 'v-taper', 'body-fat'],
  productIds: ['creatine_mono'],
  forumCategory: 'height-frame',
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'Why Core and Neck Matter',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Two of the most overlooked muscle groups that have outsized impact on your appearance:

**The Neck:**
A thick neck makes your head look proportionate, adds masculinity, and completely changes how you're perceived. Think about the difference between a pencil neck and a football player neck. Night and day.

**The Core:**
Beyond aesthetics, a strong core improves posture, supports lifting heavy, and defines that V-taper from waist. Weak core = weak everything else.

Most guys skip both because:
- Neck training seems weird or unsafe
- Core work is boring (crunches in the corner)
- Neither is a "mirror muscle"

This is a mistake. Both are trainable, and both pay massive dividends.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'neck-benefits',
      title: 'Neck: The Masculine Multiplier',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `A thick neck is one of the most underrated aesthetic upgrades you can make:

**Visual Benefits:**
- Head looks proportionate to body
- Jawline appears stronger
- More masculine/dominant presence
- Fills out shirt collars
- Better photos from every angle

**Functional Benefits:**
- Reduced neck pain
- Better posture support
- Injury prevention (sports, accidents)
- Improved head position for mewing

**The Reality:**
Compare a skinny neck to a thick neck on the same person. It's a completely different look. Yet almost nobody trains it.

The neck is one of the fastest-growing muscle groups because most people have never trained it. You can add an inch to your neck in 2-3 months with consistent training.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'neck-anatomy',
      title: 'Neck Muscles to Train',
      humorLevel: 'low',
      content: `Understanding what you're training helps you train it better:

**Sternocleidomastoid (SCM)**
- The muscles on the front/sides of your neck
- Creates that "thick neck" look from the front
- Trained with neck curls and lateral flexion

**Trapezius (Upper Traps)**
- The muscles connecting neck to shoulders
- Creates width and thickness from behind
- Trained with shrugs and neck extensions

**Splenius (Deep Neck Extensors)**
- Muscles on the back of the neck
- Important for head position and posture
- Trained with neck extensions

**Scalenes**
- Side of neck, often tight from desk work
- Important for balanced development
- Trained with lateral neck flexion

**Training All Directions:**
The neck moves in four directions:
1. Flexion (chin to chest)
2. Extension (looking up)
3. Lateral flexion (ear to shoulder)
4. Rotation (turning head)

Train all of them for balanced development.`,
    },

## Guide Data Structure Exploration Report

I've completed a thorough exploration of the guide data files and structure in the LOOKSMAXX codebase. Here's a comprehensive analysis:

### Overview

**Total Guides:** 62 complete guide files + 2 legacy guides (training, diet) = 67 exported guides

- 62 individual guide files (e.g., mindset.ts, skincare.ts, etc.)

- 1 products-registry.ts (affiliate products database)

---

### Guides by Category (13 Total Categories)

1. **Fundamentals (3 guides):** mindset, maintenance, body-fat

4. **Toxin Avoidance (3 guides):** toxins-aesthetics, toxic-swaps, environmental-stress

7. **Diet & Nutrition (6 guides):** nutrition-basics, cutting-guide, bulking-guide, keto-lowcarb, carb-timing, debloating-protocol
8. **Physique & Training (7 guides):** v-taper, training-fundamentals, full-body-split, upper-lower-split, ppl-split, core-neck, cardio

13. **Surgery (4 guides):** rhinoplasty, jaw-surgery, facial-procedures, body-surgery
14. **Legacy (2 guides):** training, diet

---

### Guide Type Definitions (`src/types/guides.ts`)

All guides implement the `Guide` interface with the following structure:

**Required Fields:**
- `id` (string) - Unique identifier
- `slug` (string) - URL-friendly slug
- `title` (string) - Display title
- `description` (string) - Short description
- `icon` (string) - Icon name or emoji
- `humorLevel` ('low' | 'medium' | 'medium-high' | 'high')
- `estimatedReadTime` (number) - Minutes to read
- `order` (number) - Display order
- `sections` (GuideSection[]) - Content sections

**Optional Fields:**
- `subtitle` (string) - Funny subtitle
- `tags` (string[]) - Search tags
- `relatedGuides` (string[]) - Guide IDs of related guides
- `productIds` (string[]) - Product IDs referenced in guide
- `forumCategory` (string) - Forum category slug for discussions
- `genderTarget` ('male' | 'female' | 'all') - Gender filtering (currently not used)
- `heroMedia` (GuideMedia) - Hero image/GIF for the guide

---

- All guides have `relatedGuides` defined (62/62 = 100%)
- All guides have `productIds` defined (62/62 = 100%)

- All guides in categories are correctly referenced

- Media support: GIFs, images, videos with captions and placements

**Important Note:** The `genderTarget` field is defined in the type interface but **NOT IMPLEMENTED** in any of the 62 guides (0/62).

The filtering logic exists in `index.ts`:

```javascript
  const femaleGuideIds = ['anti-aging-women', 'glass-skin', 'hormonal-skin', 'body-contouring-women', 'postpartum-recovery', 'feminine-features'];
  // ... filters based on hardcoded IDs, not genderTarget field
}
```
